message_1: What is the percent yield of magnesium oxide when 10.0 grams of magnesium is reacted with excess oxygen and 12.5 grams of magnesium oxide is produced? The theoretical yield of the reaction is 16.2 grams.
message_2:
To calculate the percent yield of magnesium oxide, we can use the following formula:

Percent Yield = (Actual Yield / Theoretical Yield) × 100

In this case, the actual yield is the amount of magnesium oxide produced, which is 12.5 grams. The theoretical yield is given as 16.2 grams.

Percent Yield = (12.5 grams / 16.2 grams) × 100

Percent Yield = 0.7716 × 100

Percent Yield ≈ 77.16%

The percent yield of magnesium oxide in this reaction is approximately 77.16%.
